name: ecopilot

languageModelTools.name: ecopilot_calculate_impact
languageModelTools.userDescription: This tool calculates the environmental impact of AI model usage, including COâ‚‚ emissions and energy consumption. It should be used to inform users about the environmental cost of AI usage.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Call format: {inputTokens: <prompt_tokens>, outputTokens: <response_tokens>, model: <model_name_from_context>} or {tokens: <total_tokens>, model: <model_name_from_context>}. IMPORTANT: Use the exact model identifier from your context/session (e.g., the 'model' property from languageModelAccessInformation). Separate input and output tokens for maximum accuracy, or provide total tokens if separate counts unavailable. This calculates COâ‚‚ emissions and energy consumption.

inputTokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt/input (preferred for accuracy)

outputTokens.description: Number of tokens generated in the response/output (preferred for accuracy)

tokens.description: Total number of tokens (input + output). Use inputTokens + outputTokens separately when possible for better accuracy.

model.description: The exact model identifier that was used to generate the response (e.g., 'gpt-4o', 'claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022', 'gemini-1.5-pro')

ecopilot.electricityMix.description: Electricity mix zone for server-side computation. Affects CO2 impact calculations based on local energy sources.

enumDescriptions: EcoLogits - Open-source environmental impact calculator for AI models
ecopilot.impactProvider.description: Environmental impact calculation provider. EcoLogits is the default and recommended provider.
